revised_title: Mechanisms of Melting in Alkali Thiocyanates: Crystal Structure and Entropy
tldr: This study investigates the low melting points of alkali thiocyanates, focusing on the crystal structure and entropy of fusion. The authors found that the low melting points are due to the contribution of association complexes in the melt, which increase the entropy of fusion without requiring large heat or volume changes. The experiments also showed marked homophase premelting in solid potassium thiocyanate.
